definition: to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
sleeve/to tuck inside one's sleeve
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
surname Guan
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
Taoist monastery/palace gate watchtower/platform

sentences.english: We must not stand by when people damage state property.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须与坏人坏事作斗争，不能袖手旁观。

sentences.english: The protesters were throwing bottles at Japanese restaurants, as the police looked on laughing.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者们向日本餐馆扔鞋，警方则袖手旁观看笑话。

sentences.english: No man could stand aside in such a condition.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，不会有人袖手旁观的。

sentences.english: What does 'T. G. ' stand for in 'T. G. Smith'?
sentences.chinese: 他那样虐待他的狗，你怎能袖手旁观呢？

sentences.english: But I can't just sit back and watch either. I'm pretty pissed at him too, you know.
sentences.chinese: 但我也不能袖手旁观，我也看他不顺眼，明白吗？

sentences.english: I wouldn't sit aside when somebody's being harmed.
sentences.chinese: 我不会看着别人受到伤害而袖手旁观。

sentences.english: The ships of the Athenians and their allies sulked unhelpfully.
sentences.chinese: 雅典人及其同盟军的船只袖手旁观。

sentences.english: If good people stand by , evil will conquer all.
sentences.chinese: 如果好人袖手旁观，邪恶势力就会战胜一切。

sentences.english: Three Little Stupas sitting by a tree.
sentences.chinese: 三小舍利塔袖手旁观一棵树。

sentences.english: Joe sat back in his seat, leaning hard on it.
sentences.chinese: 乔在他的座位中袖手旁观，在它上努力地倾斜。

definition: to sit and watch, but remain indifferent (idiom)
not to get involved/to stay out of it
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
to get involved in/to meddle/interference
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
powerless to defend oneself (idiom); helpless
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to stand aside and do nothing (idiom)/to take no part in
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
assistance/a helping hand/to lend a hand
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
